string.text: According to General Voronin, only Freedom has one of these guns. How I get it is my own business. I was told that one way would be to hang out with the Freedom stalker called Chef. The General says he likes his drink more than he should. I should stock up on vodka just in case I can use it.
Monolith is going to attempt a breakthrough. The key thing is not to push ahead first.

1: Freedom has acquired RG-6 grenade launchers. Two of them. One is in the arsenal, the other somewhere in the village.\n\n
Track down the snitch. Don't come closer than 30 meters or he will see me.\n Kill the snitch after he meets his agent.\nKill the agent as well.

1: Today we went to the village again on a hunt. Same as always. 

 2: Where did that beast come from? Must have sneaked through near Radar. All the guys are down, I'm the only one standing… I'll try to sneak out at night… 

 3: I don't remember how I got out. It was pure hell... My head is splitting open - pictures, sounds, I don't know where they are coming from. Goddamn radiation. On top of that, the bloody detector is kaputt. I must rest to get some relief.
Enter the base with Duty members.\nEliminate three snipers. \nKill Lukash.
Kill the sniper at the tower. Be careful, don't catch a bullet between the eyes.

Crap, those Duty assholes kicked us out from a fat place. They dug in near our farmstead. We didn't even have time to get our things from the attic. No big deal though - Freedom base is near, so they won't hang on too long.
Today we shook down a few soldiers on their way to Radar - scored some RG-6s. They are awesome. Lukash took one, and Murk hid the other in the village, in one of the basements.

1. The Devil made me go to Radar. I barely made it - a little slower and I would have made for just another exhibit with liquified brains.

 2: Four thugs surrounded me like I was a three-year old. I did my part - didn't see their trap. I was only saved by their chattiness and greed. Instead of stuffing me full of lead, they jumped out and began disrobing me - got hooked on the suit. That was their last mistake; still, one of them caught me with a bullet... heh, I'm getting old...

 3: By the time I arrived, Hawkeye's messenger was no longer breathing. Three bloodsuckers are a match for anyone, but this guy took out four of them, and a few more bloody trails lead out in different directions. The only information on him is a door code (19840519), but identifying the door it unlocks doesn't seem possible.

 4: We intercepted a few army men on their way to Radar. They carried no documents or orders, but were very adequately equipped. I think I'll leave that RG-6 in the basement until I need it.
Hrm. I will get my reward at Freedom's base from Skinflint… Nice name. I should hope for a can of meat with last year's best by date.
Clean out the bloodsuckers in the village. Got to be careful or they'll drink all my blood and leave me for dead.

Monolith is going to attempt a breakthrough. The key thing is not to push ahead first.
I wonder what this crazy guy at the swamp can possibly know. I'll figure it out. The important thing is to avoid all those old mines. But - they must be rusty enough to explode from a bolt.
